item.title: Rio add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Rio add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Rio add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Rio add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Rio add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Rio add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are no uninteresting things, only uninterested people." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Rio add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Rio add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The truth is that everyone is bored, and devotes himself to cultivating habits." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rio add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Boredom is the conviction that you can't change ... the shriek of unused capacities." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Rio add a quote by Metallica
item.description: "Boredom comes from a boring mind." -- Metallica

item.title: Rio add a quote by Ruth Burke
item.description: "Only boring people get bored." -- Ruth Burke

item.title: Rio add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Our labour preserves us from three great evils -- weariness, vice, and want." -- Voltaire

item.title: Rio add a quote by eric hoffer
item.description: "When people are bored, it is primarily with their own selves that they are bored." -- eric hoffer

item.title: Rio add a quote by Marie Josephine Suin De Beausacq
item.description: "Boredom is the fear of self." -- Marie Josephine Suin De Beausacq

item.title: Rio add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "I don't believe in an afterlife, so I don't have to spend my whole life fearing hell, or fearing heaven even more. For whatever the tortures of hell, I think the boredom of heaven would be even worse." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Rio add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Martin in particular concluded that man was born to live either in the convulsions of misery, or in the lethargy of boredom." -- Voltaire

item.title: Rio add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "My life is very monotonous," the fox said. "I hunt chickens; men hunt me. All the chickens are just alike, and all the men are just alike. And, in consequence, I am a little bored." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Rio add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description:
"I'm bored with it all.
- Last Words" -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Rio add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "I am never bored; to be bored is an insult to one's self." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Rio add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Monotony has nothing to do with a place; monotony, either in its sensation or its infliction, is simply the quality of a person. There are no dreary sights; there are only dreary sight seers." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Rio add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Any country where I am not bored is a country that teaches me nothing." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rio add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Isn’t ‘not to be bored’ one of the principal goals of life?" -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Rio add a quote by Kate Ross
item.description: "I always think boredom is to some extent the fault of the bored." -- Kate Ross

item.title: Rio add a quote by William Inge
item.description: "Nobody is bored when he is trying to make something that is beautiful, or to discover something that is true." -- William Inge

item.title: Rio add a quote by François de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "We are almost always bored by just those whom we must not find boring." -- François de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: Rio add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Pensive they sit, and roll their languid eyes." -- John Keats

item.title: Rio add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "You need to let the little things that would ordinarily bore you suddenly thrill you." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Rio add a quote by Toba Beta
item.description: "Feeling bored is a childish attitude. You wouldn't feel so if you don't rely on somebody to change your feeling." -- Toba Beta

item.title: Rio add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Nothing happens. Nobody comes, nobody goes. It’s awful." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Rio add a quote by Hal Sparks
item.description: "Boredom is your mind and body’s way of telling you you’re not living up to your potential." -- Hal Sparks
